original_text:
**INSTITUTION
CRITICAL CARE MEDICINE
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN PROGRESS NOTE
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Feb 12 2007]
EVALUATION DATE :
**DATE[Feb 29 07]
I am managing this critically ill **AGE[in 60s]- year - old female who is status post sternal wound infection and debridement .
Her hospital course has been complicated by respiratory insufficiency .
I am seeing her for management of her infection , respiratory failure and hyperglycemia .
I have seen and examined the patient , reviewed her laboratory , radiographic and EMTEK data , and discussed the management with the surgeons .
PROBLEMS AND MANAGEMENT :
1. Sternal wound infection :
The patient is going to the operating room today for debridement .
I have her on vancomycin and cefepime to cover her gram - negative rods and gram - positive cocci in the culture .
White blood cell count is up today at 23,000 , which is somewhat concerning .
There have been no fevers .
I have given her 1 unit of packed red blood cells for hemoglobin of 8 and hematocrit of 24 .
2. Respiratory failure :
Chest x-ray shows some increase in the bilateral effusions and pulmonary vascular congestion .
On the vent , I have her on assist control .
Her peak airway pressures , minute ventilation and gas exchange have been adequate .
In light of her trip back to the operating room today , I have left her on full mechanical ventilatory support .
3. Hyperglycemia :
Blood glucoses have been between the 180 and 200 range on moderate - dose sliding - scale insulin .
I have changed her to an insulin drip for tight glycemic control .
Total critical care time = 40 minutes .
___________________________________
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
**INITIALS
D :
**DATE[Feb 29 2007] 19:37:21
T :
**DATE[Feb 29 2007] 23:56:07
